result.execSummary:
The defendant Avin A James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $300.00 including all costs and surcharges or in the alternitive serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days for a time served disposition.

Perform 35 hours of community service by 06/06/16. If the defendant successfully completes the community service and commits no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause, court will grant expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Avin A James

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: If the defendant successfully completes the community service and commits no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause, Court will grant expungement.

Defendant Avin A James in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $300.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES or in the alternative serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days credit FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered the defendant to perform 35 hours of community service by June 6, 2016.  If the defendant successfully completes the community service and commits no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause, Court will grant expungement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Defendant Avin A James in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Avin A James in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Avin A James in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
